title: Markdown CV Notes Blog (Paper Texture Theme)

requirements.summary: Implement public blog UI with a post list home page and a post detail reading page, including navigation back to the list.
acceptanceCriteria: Home page shows a list/grid of posts with title and date (and optional excerpt).
Clicking a post navigates to a dedicated post page with the full content.
Navigation includes a clear way to return to the list view (e.g., breadcrumb/back link).
All user-facing UI text is in English.

file_operations.description: Create the app shell and client-side routing for the blog, wiring routes for the post list view (home) and post detail view (by slug), plus a shared layout that includes the header and an always-available way to return to the list.
Create a layout component that wraps all blog pages, renders the header area, and provides consistent page structure (content max-width, reading-friendly spacing) across list and detail views.
Create the home/list page that reads the post manifest and renders posts in a list/grid with title, date, and optional excerpt, with each item linking to the post detail route.
Create the post detail page that loads a single post by slug, displays its title/date, renders the full Markdown content, and includes a visible back link/breadcrumb to the list page.
Create a reusable presentational component for a post preview card used on the list page (title/date/excerpt styling consistent with the theme).
Create a small not-found/empty-state component for missing slugs or empty lists, ensuring all user-facing text is in English.

requirements.summary: Load posts from static Markdown assets via a manifest and render Markdown safely on the post detail page (including code, links, and images).
acceptanceCriteria: Posts can be authored as .md files placed in a designated static folder (e.g., a notes/ or posts/ directory under frontend public assets).
The app has an index/manifest (e.g., a JSON file or equivalent build-time list) that maps each post to its title, date, slug, and markdown filename.
Markdown rendering correctly displays headings, paragraphs, lists, fenced code blocks, inline code, links, and images referenced by relative paths to static assets.
Markdown rendering is sanitized to prevent script injection (no raw HTML execution).

file_operations.description: Add a static post manifest mapping each post to title, date, slug, and markdown filename; this is the single index used by the UI to list and locate Markdown files.
Add an example Markdown post file under the designated static posts folder to validate headings, lists, links, code blocks, and image references.
Define TypeScript types for the post manifest records and loaded Markdown content to keep the UI strongly typed.
Implement static-asset loaders that fetch the manifest JSON and fetch raw Markdown by filename from the public posts directory (no backend involvement).
Create React Query hooks for (1) loading the manifest and (2) loading a postâ€™s Markdown content by slug/filename, including basic loading/error states.
Implement a Markdown rendering component that supports headings, lists, fenced code blocks, inline code, links, and images, and enforces safe rendering by sanitizing/disallowing raw HTML execution.
Add required Markdown rendering/sanitization libraries (and any needed routing library if not already present) so Markdown can be rendered safely with support for code blocks, links, and images.
Wire Markdown loading and safe Markdown rendering into the post detail page using the manifest mapping and the Markdown renderer component.
Load the manifest from the static posts directory and render the list based on manifest metadata (not by parsing Markdown at runtime).

requirements.summary: Apply a consistent gentle paper-textured illustration theme across all pages (warm palette, subtle texture/grain, reading-optimized typography).
acceptanceCriteria: App background uses a subtle paper texture effect and warm neutral colors (not blue/purple-dominant).
Typography is optimized for long-form reading (comfortable line height, max content width, clear heading hierarchy).
UI components (cards, buttons, nav) match the illustration-paper theme with consistent styling.
Theme is applied across the post list and post detail views without inconsistent default styling.

file_operations.description: Create global styles to establish warm, paper-like CSS variables, apply a subtle paper texture background using the generated asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/paper-texture.dim_2048x2048.png, and set reading-friendly typography defaults (line height, content width, heading rhythm).
Extend Tailwind theme tokens (colors/radius/shadows/typography usage) to align with the warm paper theme and ensure consistent styling utilities across pages.
Apply the themed layout styling (paper card surfaces, hand-drawn accent styling, consistent spacing) so both list and detail pages share the same visual language.
Style post preview cards to match the illustration-paper theme (warm surfaces, subtle borders/shadows, comfortable spacing) and avoid inconsistent default styling.
Apply reading-friendly Markdown typography styling (using Tailwind typography/prose conventions) so headings, code blocks, links, and lists fit the paper-note theme consistently.

requirements.summary: Add a persistent header (blog title + optional tagline) and client-side search/filter on the post list page.
acceptanceCriteria: Header is visible on main pages and includes the blog title.
Post list includes a search input that filters posts by title (and optionally tags).
Filtering is client-side and updates results immediately without a page reload.

file_operations.description: Create a header component that displays the blog title and an optional short English tagline, and supports placing the small header illustration.
Create a search input component used on the post list page that filters posts client-side by title (and optionally other manifest metadata such as tags), updating results immediately.
Wire the BlogHeader into the shared layout so it is visible on the main pages (list and detail).
Integrate the PostSearch component and implement client-side filtering of the manifest-derived post list without page reloads.

requirements.summary: Add the required generated images as static assets and incorporate them into the UI (paper background, header illustration, icons) without using the backend.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced directly by the frontend.
Paper texture is visibly applied in the layout background (not only present as an unused asset).
Header illustration is displayed in the header/hero area with appropriate sizing and responsiveness.

file_operations.description: Add the generated paper texture image as a static frontend asset at the required path so it can be referenced directly by the UI.
Add the generated header illustration image as a static frontend asset at the required path so it can be rendered in the header.
Add the generated icon set image as a static frontend asset at the required path for use alongside header/search/meta UI.
Reference frontend/public/assets/generated/paper-texture.dim_2048x2048.png in global styling so the paper texture is visibly applied to the app background (served as a static asset, not via backend).
Render the header illustration from frontend/public/assets/generated/header-illustration.dim_1600x400.png within the header area with responsive sizing.
Use the icon asset frontend/public/assets/generated/cv-notes-icons.dim_384x128.png to visually reinforce search/filter affordances in a lightweight, theme-consistent way.
